decks.notes: The main concept of this deck is to apply pressure to the opponent quickly and efficiently. By utilizing cheap and aggressive creatures like Delver of Secrets, Dragon's Rage Channeler, and Murktide Regent, along with efficient removal spells like Unholy Heat and Lightning Bolt, the deck aims to keep the opponent on the back foot and disrupt their game plan. By utilizing cards like Daze, Force of Will, and Wasteland, the deck also aims to disrupt the opponent's resources while maintaining its aggressive momentum. Overall, the deck's strategy revolves around aggressive play and resource denial.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly and efficiently fill the graveyard with powerful creature cards, such as Archon of Cruelty and Atraxa, Grand Unifier, using cards like Entomb and Brainstorm. Once these creatures are in the graveyard, the deck aims to bring them back onto the battlefield using spells like Reanimate and Animate Dead. Additionally, cards like Daze and Force of Will are included to protect the combo pieces and disrupt opponents' strategies. The deck also includes some control elements like Thoughtseize and Brazen Borrower to help maintain board presence.

The main concept of this Eldrazi Aggro deck is to quickly ramp up mana using cards like Ancient Tomb, Eldrazi Temple, and Lotus Petal, allowing for powerful Eldrazi creatures like Thought-Knot Seer and Glaring Fleshraker to be played ahead of schedule. The deck also utilizes disruptive cards like Chalice of the Void and Wasteland to control the opponent's resources. The inclusion of The One Ring and Gaea's Cradle provide additional mana sources and synergy with the Eldrazi creatures. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm opponents with early threats and efficient mana usage.

The deck focuses on using Cloudpost to ramp up mana quickly and efficiently with cards like Crop Rotation and Glimmerpost. It aims to generate a large amount of mana to play powerful threats such as Emrakul, the Aeons Torn and Ugin, the Spirit Dragon. The deck also has disruptive elements like Kozilek's Command and Disruptor Flute to control the board and protect its combo pieces. With access to powerful lands like Vesuva and Karakas, the deck can adapt to various strategies and outpace opponents with its massive mana advantage.

The main focus of this deck is to put pressure on the opponent with fast and aggressive creatures like Delver of Secrets and Dragon's Rage Channeler, while disrupting their game plan with counterspells like Force of Will and Wasteland. The deck also aims to control the board with removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Unholy Heat. It utilizes cantrips like Ponder and Brainstorm to dig for the key cards needed to close out the game. Overall, the strategy emphasizes early aggression, disruption, and card advantage to outpace the opponent in a fast-paced Legacy 1 vs 1 format.

The main concept of this deck is to establish control of the board early on by playing aggressive creatures and utilizing mana acceleration cards like Chrome Mox and Simian Spirit Guide. The deck also focuses on disrupting opponent's strategies with cards like Magus of the Moon to shut down non-basic lands. The key strategy is to quickly build up a strong board presence and apply pressure to the opponent while also having the ability to adapt to different situations with versatile spells like Fury and Fable of the Mirror-Breaker.

This deck aims to utilize the combo potential of Nadu, Winged Wisdom in Legacy 1 vs 1 matches. The deck includes various cards that help find and protect Nadu, such as Green Sun's Zenith and Force of Will. It also has cards like Nomads en-Kor to fuel the combo and cards like Delighted Halfling for additional support. The inclusion of cards like Teferi, Time Raveler and Swords to Plowshares adds versatility and control elements to the deck. Ultimately, the goal is to achieve a quick and powerful win using the Nadu combo.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly send powerful creatures to the graveyard with cards like Entomb and Thoughtseize, then bringing them back onto the battlefield with Reanimate and Animate Dead. Utilizing cards like Brainstorm and Ponder to dig through the deck for combo pieces, this deck aims to overwhelm opponents with early game aggression and powerful creature abilities. The deck also includes disruption spells like Force of Will and Daze to protect its combo pieces and stop opponents from interfering with its game plan.

This deck focuses on fast, aggressive plays using Dragon Stompy creatures and spells to disrupt opponent's strategies. Utilizing mana acceleration from City of Traitors, Ancient Tomb, and Simian Spirit Guide, the deck aims to lock down the opponent's mana base with Blood Moon and Sundering Eruption while deploying powerful threats like Pyrogoyf and Karn, the Great Creator. Fable of the Mirror-Breaker provides additional card advantage and Fury offers removal options. The deck also includes utility cards like Lotus Petal and Gemstone Caverns to further support its aggressive game plan.

The main concept of this deck is to assemble the Cephalid Breakfast combo by using Cephalid Illusionist and Nomads en-Kor to mill your library, then use Dread Return to bring back Thassa's Oracle and win the game by having no cards remaining in your library. The deck also includes various control elements such as Force of Will and Teferi, Time Raveler to protect the combo and disrupt your opponent's game plan. Additionally, there are some mana fixing cards like Flooded Strand and Meticulous Archive to help ensure you can cast your spells effectively.

The key strategy of this deck is to quickly assemble the necessary combo pieces to generate infinite mana and storm count, allowing for a lethal Grapeshot finish. The deck includes various card draw and tutoring effects to find key pieces quickly, while also disrupting the opponent's game plan with cards like Defense Grid and Chain of Vapor. Utilizing cards like Lion's Eye Diamond and Mox Opal, the deck aims to create explosive turns and overwhelm the opponent before they can respond effectively. The land base includes specific dual lands to support the deck's color requirements and to enable powerful synergies with Urza's Saga.
